Package lib.homies.framework.party

Class DefaultParty

java.lang.Object
lib.homies.framework.party.DefaultParty
All Implemented Interfaces:
Party
public class DefaultParty extends Object implements Party
Default, platform-independent implementation of the Party interface. This class manages party members, leader, and provides basic party functionality. It leverages MessageUtils for sending messages to party members.

  • Constructor Summary

  • Constructor Details

    • DefaultParty

      public DefaultParty(HomiesPlayer leader)
      Constructs a new DefaultParty with the given player as the initial leader. A unique ID is generated for the party, and the leader is automatically added as a member.
      Parameters:
      leader - The HomiesPlayer who will be the leader of the new party.

    • addMember

      public void addMember(HomiesPlayer player)
      Adds a player to the party. If the player is successfully added, a message is sent to all party members.
      Specified by:
      addMember in interface Party
      Parameters:
      player - The HomiesPlayer to add to the party.

    • removeMember

      public void removeMember(HomiesPlayer player)
      Removes a player from the party. If the player is successfully removed, a message is sent to all party members. If the removed player was the leader, leadership is transferred to another member. If the party becomes empty, it is implicitly handled by the PartyService.
      Specified by:
      removeMember in interface Party
      Parameters:
      player - The HomiesPlayer to remove from the party.

    • setLeader

      public void setLeader(HomiesPlayer newLeader)
      Sets a new leader for the party. A message is sent to all party members announcing the leadership change.
      Specified by:
      setLeader in interface Party
      Parameters:
      newLeader - The HomiesPlayer to set as the new leader.

      Parameters:
      player - The HomiesPlayer to check.
      Returns:
      true if the player is a member, false otherwise.
